section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Council" means the Council for the Procurement of Health, Educational, and Social Services.

"Health, educational, and social services" means services procured to provide or assist in providing:
support, care, or shelter to third-party clients under a contract; or
training to third-party clients under a contract.

"Task Force Report" means the report entitled "Task Force Report to the Governor and the General Assembly on Procurement of Health, Education and Social Services by State Agencies" that was issued on November 30, 2011, by the Task Force to Study the Procurement of Health, Education, and Social Services by State Agencies.

text.section: There is a Council for the Procurement of Health, Educational, and Social Services.

section.section: If the State Treasurer is unable to attend a meeting of the Council, the Treasurer may designate a Deputy Treasurer to attend the meeting.

If a member of the Council listed in paragraph (1)(ii) through (xii) of this subsection is unable to attend a meeting of the Council, the member may designate the Chief Procurement Officer or another senior management staff member of the agency or organization to attend the meeting.

text.section: The Procurement Advisor is the Chair of the Council.
The Council shall meet at least twice each year.

The staffing responsibilities of the Council shall be shared by:
the agencies represented on the Council; and
additional staff that the Board authorizes in accordance with the State budget.
